title: Can Riot Fearless get fired from the balance team?
body:
I mean a tank main with a negative winrate in silver making a new mastery which gives tanks a 2000 hp shield in teamfights (CoC) probably is really fit to make balance decisions in this game.

Edit: It clearly says "fired from the balance team" in the title...please stop acting like I want him to be fired from Riot.

replies.body:
1. Why are you acting like it was his idea and his idea only?
2. Why are you acting like the rest of the balance team didn't sign off on it?
3. Why are you acting like the play testers didn't think it was in a decent enough spot?
Ofc it was his idea...one of the new tank masteries is even called "Fearless" lmao.
Still have points 2 and 3.

2. Cause Riot's policy is to work as a team and let everyone have a say....he prolly got alot of bogus mastery suggestions denied so they decided to atleast let him get away with a couple less retarded ones.

3. Because the play testers never let any broken stuff go to live...especially not in the preseason. Remember Preseason 6 where you could stack fervor by hitting minions?

EdIt: Idk why it changes the numbers to 1 and 2...

Just odd forum code. It does that. 

But you brought up a good point. Back in the season 6 preseason fervor could be stacked by hitting minions (and warlords broke Yasuo and Tryndamere). The masteries then got nerfed. 

Now that it's the **preseason** again, we're going to get a bunch of shit that is going to be stupid at first. **That's pretty much intended in a preseason**. It's when a bunch of new things are added in and are balanced out as it goes on. 

If this was the second week or something, you might have a good argument. **But it's the second day** so maybe you should just wait and see how it turns out after healthily expressing your constructive opinion. 

**Demanding for a Rioter to be fired based on something they added in the preseason isn't a constructive opinion.**

Fair enough but I don't what a guy who cant even play the game properly and makes obviously biased decisions is doing in the balance team anyway? 

Nothing against him personally but if you are chilling in silver with a negative winrate after 300 ranked games you are not good at the game and you shouldn't make balance decisions for players who play the game at a much higher level.

I've heard several Rioters say they're silver. You want them fired too? You don't have to be able to play the game brilliantly to design it. I did not tend to win my big space conquest boardgame despite being the sole designer. Remember that Riot employees have access to _data_... tons of it. That's how they playbalance things; not by feeling it ingame.

{{champion:51}}

He still has to get other people to agree with him. 
And the mastery is obviously going to get nerfed anyway. And not just because a bunch of people don't read patch notes and don't understand how the new things work.

I love how you're launching constant attacks at one person's ideas and character because of your salt over tanks getting a large conditional shield.  People have been complaining all season about tanks not being tanky enough, and now that there's a partial solution to that problem people start bitching about the solution.  What exactly is your problem with Courage of the Colossus.
Tanks were always tanky enough when you played them right....but if you think Malphite ulting the enemy team and getting a 2000hp shield as a reward is ok you are probably a little biased :)

A shield that drops off after four seconds on a champion that your team shouldn't be focusing anyway.

The only times I've seen it actually come in handy are people forgetting about its existence during laning phase and towerdiving a tank who has it only to get turned on and killed because the shield gave them just enough survivability.  In actual teamfights if you're being focused that means that the enemy team is doing something wrong or your team is way too far back and you're going to die anyway, now it'll just take a couple seconds longer.
You could never stack Fervor against minions, it was Warlord's that allowed you to heal from minions though.
Yes you could lmao...stop spreading wrong stuff.
Both of you are high as fuck lol

Do you know why Morellonomicon is called Morellonomicon?

Why Guinsoo's Rageblade is called Guinsoo's Rageblade?

Same reason the Total Biscuit of Rejuvenation is called the Total Biscuit of Rejuvenation, yet Total Biscuit didn't design the item as he doesn't work at Riot.

When was the last time we had something actually named after a Rioter? It's been *years*. Seems odd to do it now when the words not clearly a name.
If you think that being good at the game is the same thing as understanding how the game works and how you should balance it, you're misguided...
the op is just an all around entitled asshole honestly, this whole post is just evidence that some people really have no respect.
Wow... so much hate with so little evidence.
http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=fearless

He mains tanks...he is bad enough at them to not even get out of Silver having a negative winrate in 300 ranked games. So he wants stronger tank masteries. One of them is even called "Fearless" lmao.

Tank masteries haven't been that great. Tank ITEMS are overpowered (hence why you saw even assassin champs going iceborn/sunfire last season and a whole slew of other phases)

They have said recently they want to get tank items in a "healthier" place. And getting some their masteries up that work best _for tanks_ is a step in the right direction.

yada yada talk; Also saying tank items are overpowered is oversimplification. I think they just spike too hard in certain times and ways. It's because we actually finally nerfed % pen to the point they are actual tradeoffs start of season 6. And that's why tanks were crazy first part of season 6. And then they knee jerk nerfed the resolve tree. But that wasn't the problem. So (imo) while it's a classic thing the game has that tanks are powerful mid game and (tbh) get dominated late game by carries I think this needs to be spread out a teensy bit. While doing that though the one class you gotta be mindful of is the bruisers who generally like some tank items and some damage items.
Are you this person that always focuses tanks in teamfights?
No I am busy diving the backline...but with dmg champs.

Not convinced ones ability to directly play the game is directly correlated with their ability to design aspects of it.

Also, the design of a mastery (how it works e.g. shields from cc) is distinct from the balance of it (how big the shields are).

On one hand, it's good to have some Rioters that are down in silver like the majority of players are. They know what it's like down there by firsthand experience.

On the other hand, I'm not comfortable with silver players making balance decisions for everyone.
He's not the only one the balance team he doesn't just get to make changes on a whim

Of course it's a team effort, that's why it's a balance **team**.

However, he wouldn't be part of the team if he didn't help make changes. He brings a silver prospective, and that's both good and bad.

This right here is why our world is slowly going to shit.

Preseason is all about trying radically new things and then balancing them over the course of a month or 2.  EVEN IF THIS MASTERY WAS OP, which I don't think it is they would slowly nerf it until its in the right spot.
